page.title: 06Farming-Llanhari area
page.content: Some 50% of the area surveyed is farmland with an average farm size of 60 hectares.Most farms in the area are mixed stock or dairy farms.Cattle and sheep are sold at Cowbridge or Newport Market and milk is sold to the Milk Marketing Board.The farms are mainly family run businesses and therefore no more than two people,other than the family are employed.Most ofthe land is permanent pasture with some ley pasture and fodder crops.Liver fluke is the most common problem in the area and this requires farmers to treat cattle frequently. During winter months most animals are kept under cover.This is a busy period as calving also begins at this time. Food for the winter is collected during spring and summer. Shearing occurs in May.Wool is sold to The Wool Marketing Board.
